title: How to Make Sambar from Scratch With Whole Spices

steps.headline: Take a cup of sambar dhal (lentil) add water and boil in a pressure cooker for 3-4 whistles.
steps.description: If you don't have a pressure cooker, boil the dhal with water in a vessel until it becomes soft.

steps.headline: Put a small lime sized tamarind portion in a small bowl of water.
Add 2 tbsp oil into a pan.
Fry the whole red chillies, coriander (dhaniya) seeds, fenugreek (methi) seeds and asafoetida piece in this oil, until the coriander seeds become a light brown.
Grind the fried spices (masala) in a mixer-grinder with a little water until it is a fine paste.
Cut vegetables (except tomato) into inch cubes (see vegetable options in Ingredients), and boil with water in a vessel with haldi (turmeric).
Add the masala paste to the boiled vegetables.
After 10 minutes add in salt to taste (2 tbsp of rock salt tastes best), and squeeze the tamarind water into the vessel with vegetables.
steps.description: Throw away the tamarind rind after 2-3 such extractions.

steps.headline: Let the mixture boil until the vegetables are cooked.
steps.description: Make sure the watery content is more than the vegetables.

steps.headline: Heat mustard seeds in 1 tbsp oil till they splutter.
Garnish with chopped coriander (dhaniya) leaves and serve!

text: Take a cup of sambar dhal (lentil) add water and boil in a pressure cooker for 3-4 whistles. If you don't have a pressure cooker, boil the dhal with water in a vessel until it becomes soft. Put a small lime sized tamarind portion in a small bowl of water.  Add 2 tbsp oil into a pan.  Fry the whole red chillies, coriander (dhaniya) seeds, fenugreek (methi) seeds and asafoetida piece in this oil, until the coriander seeds become a light brown.  Grind the fried spices (masala) in a mixer-grinder with a little water until it is a fine paste.  Cut vegetables (except tomato) into inch cubes (see vegetable options in Ingredients), and boil with water in a vessel with haldi (turmeric).  Add the masala paste to the boiled vegetables.  After 10 minutes add in salt to taste (2 tbsp of rock salt tastes best), and squeeze the tamarind water into the vessel with vegetables. Throw away the tamarind rind after 2-3 such extractions. Let the mixture boil until the vegetables are cooked. Make sure the watery content is more than the vegetables. Heat mustard seeds in 1 tbsp oil till they splutter. Add this to the Sambar. Garnish with chopped coriander (dhaniya) leaves and serve!
